page.title: 14PENZANCE HELIPORT, GULVAL
page.content: British Airways operate the only public{helicopter service}in the country from just outside Penzance to the{Isles of Scilly.}It takes 20 minutes to fly 27 passengers and their luggage about 40 miles to St.Mary's. The Sikorsky helicopter, travelling at 140 m.p.h., makes about 12 flights a day and carries around 80,000 passengers a year. It uses 100 gallons of kerosene for one return journey. It is crewed by two pilots and a steward. The helicopter is manoevered to face into the wind for vertical take-off. Once airborne it is much noiser than an aeroplane and there is a lot of vibration. For economy, only one helicopter is in use at a time and maintenance staff work late hours and Sundays to keep it in operation. A return ticket costs about Â£27.
